org.transitime.core

Class TimeoutHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • org.transitime.core.TimeoutHandler

  • public class TimeoutHandler
extends java.lang.Object
    For handling when a vehicle doesn't report its position for too long. Makes the vehicle unpredictable if a timeout occurs.

    Note: only predictable vehicles are timed out. This is because vehicles that are not in service are likely to get turned off and not report their position for a long period of time. Plus since they are already not predictable there is no need to be make them unpredictable when there is a timeout.

    Author:
    SkiBu Smith

    • Method Detail

      • getInstance

        public static TimeoutHandler getInstance()

      • handlePossibleTimeout

        public void handlePossibleTimeout(AvlReport newAvlReport)
        To be called every time a new AVL report is handled. This way can handle predictable vehicles timing out even when not running in real time due to running in batch/playback mode.

        Note: only predictable vehicles are timed out. This is because vehicles that are not in service are likely to get turned off and not report their position for a long period of time. Plus since they are already not predictable there is no need to be make them unpredictable when there is a timeout.

        This method is synchronized since the map itself is unsynced and need to make sure that don't have concurrent access.

        Parameters:
        avlReport -
